algorithm_technique: Prefix sums and two pointers for range queries
problem_summary_simple: Find the maximum fruits you can collect by moving at most k steps from a starting position.
problem_summary_technical: Uses prefix sums on fruit counts and two pointers to explore all valid paths (left-then-right or right-then-left) within k steps.
key_insights: The problem can be broken down into two main strategies: moving left first then right, or right first then left.
Prefix sums are crucial for efficiently calculating the sum of fruits within any range.
The two-pointer approach helps to iterate through all possible combinations of left and right movements within the k-step constraint.
